variable.name: SUBJECT_ID
variable.description: PARTICIPANT ID [Visit 6]

variable.name: VISIT
variable.description: CONTACT OCCASION [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB1
variable.description: 1. A. Sleep. You are told that you snore loudly and bother others [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB2
variable.description: 2. A. Sleep. You are told that you stop breathing (hold your breath) in sleep [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB3
variable.description: 3. A. Sleep. You fall asleep during the day, particularly when not busy [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB4
variable.description: 4. A. Sleep. You are tired after sleeping [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB5
variable.description: 5. A. Sleep. You feel sleepy or fall asleep while driving [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB6
variable.description: 6. A. Sleep. During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB7
variable.description: 7. A. Sleep. During the past month, excluding naps, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night (or day, if you work at night) on average? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB8
variable.description: 8. B. Chest pain on effort. Have you ever had any pain or discomfort in your chest since your last JHS exam ? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB9
variable.description: 9. B. Chest pain on effort. Do you get it when you walk uphill or hurry? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB10
variable.description: 10. B. Chest pain on effort. Do you get it when you walk at an ordinary pace on the level? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB11
variable.description: 11. B. Chest pain on effort. What do you do if you get it while you are walking? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB12
variable.description: 12. B. Chest pain on effort. If you stand still, what happens to it? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB13
variable.description: 13. B. Chest pain on effort. How soon [If you stand still, what happens to it?]? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB14A
variable.description: 14a. B. Chest pain on effort. Sternum (upper or middle) [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB14B
variable.description: 14b. B. Chest pain on effort. Will you show me where it was? Sternum (lower) [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB14C
variable.description: 14c. B. Chest pain on effort. Will you show me where it was? Left anterior chest [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB14D
variable.description: 14d. B. Chest pain on effort. Will you show me where it was? Left arm [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB14E
variable.description: 14e. B. Chest pain on effort. Will you show me where it was? Other [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB15
variable.description: 15. B. Chest pain on effort. Do you feel it anywhere else? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB16
variable.description: 16. B. Chest pain on effort. Did you see a doctor because of this pain or discomfort? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB17
variable.description: 17. B. Chest pain on effort. What did the doctor say it was? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB18
variable.description: 18. B. Chest pain on effort. Have you been hospitalized because of this pain? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB19
variable.description: 19. B. Chest pain on effort. How long ago did you start getting this pain? Within the past: [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB20
variable.description: 20. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, has your chest discomfort occurred more often? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB21
variable.description: 21. B. Chest pain on effort. Has it occurred at least twice as often as before? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB22
variable.description: 22. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, has the pain become more severe? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB23
variable.description: 23. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, has the pain lasted longer when it occurs? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB24
variable.description: 24. B. Chest pain on effort. Do you ever use nitroglycerin to relieve the pain? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB25
variable.description: 25. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, has the pain required more nitroglycerin to relieve it? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB26
variable.description: 26. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, have you started getting the pain with less exertion? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB27
variable.description: 27. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months have you started getting the pain when sitting still? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB28
variable.description: 28. B. Chest pain on effort. Within the past 2 months, have you started getting the pain when sleeping? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB29
variable.description: 29. C. Possible infraction. Have you ever had a severe pain across the front of your chest lasting for half an hour or more? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB30
variable.description: 30. C. Possible infraction. Did you see a doctor because of this pain? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB31
variable.description: 31. C. Possible infraction. What did the doctor say it was? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB32
variable.description: 32. C. Possible infraction. Have you ever had a heart attack for which you were hospitalized one week or more? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB33
variable.description: 33. C. Possible infraction. How many such heart attacks have you had? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB34
variable.description: 34. C. Possible infraction. How old were you when you had your (first) heart attack? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB35
variable.description: 35. C. Possible infraction. Have you ever had a test in which you were asked to exercise while an electrocardiogram was taken? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB36
variable.description: 36. C. Possible infraction. Were you told that the results were normal or abnormal? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB37
variable.description: 37. D. Intermittent claudication. Do you get pain in either leg on walking? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB38
variable.description: 38. D. Intermittent claudication. Does this pain ever begin when you are standing still or sitting? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB39
variable.description: 39. D. Intermittent claudication. In what part of your leg do you feel it? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB40
variable.description: 40. D. Intermittent claudication. Do you get it if you walk uphill or hurry? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB41
variable.description: 41. D. Intermittent claudication. Do you get it if you walk at an ordinary pace on the level? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB42
variable.description: 42. D. Intermittent claudication. Does the pain ever disappear while you are walking? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB43
variable.description: 43. D. Intermittent claudication. What do you do if you get it when you are walking? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB44
variable.description: 44. D. Intermittent claudication. What happens to it if you stand still? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB45
variable.description: 45. D. Intermittent claudication. How soon? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB46
variable.description: 46. D. Intermittent claudication. Were you hospitalized for this problem in your legs? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB47
variable.description: 47. E. Congestive heart failure. Have you had to sleep on 2 or more pillows to help you breathe? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB48
variable.description: 48. E. Congestive heart failure. Have you been awakened at night by trouble breathing? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB49
variable.description: 49. E. Congestive heart failure. Have you had swelling of your feet or ankles (excluding during pregnancy)? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB50
variable.description: 50. E. Congestive heart failure. Did it tend to come on during the day and go down overnight? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB51
variable.description: 51. F. Invasive procedures. Have you had surgery on your heart, or the arteries of your neck or legs, excluding surgery for varicose veins? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52A
variable.description: 52a. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have: coronary bypass [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52B1
variable.description: 52b1. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have: other heart procedure [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52C
variable.description: 52c. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have: carotid endarterectomy [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52D
variable.description: 52d. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have: carotid endarterectomy. Site [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52E1
variable.description: 52e1. F. Invasive procedures. Other arterial revascularization or bypass [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB52F
variable.description: 52f. F. Invasive procedures. Any other type of surgery on your heart or the arteries of your neck or legs? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB53
variable.description: 53. F. Invasive procedures. Have you had a balloon angioplasty on the arteries of your heart, neck, or legs? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB54A
variable.description: 54a. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have angioplasty of the coronary arteries [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB54B
variable.description: 54b. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have angioplasty in the arteries of your neck [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB54C
variable.description: 54c. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have angioplasty of lower extremity arteries [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB55A
variable.description: 55a. F. Invasive procedures. Heart catheterization [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB55B
variable.description: 55b. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have carotid artery catheterization [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB55C1
variable.description: 55c1. F. Invasive procedures. Did you have other arterial catheterization [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB55A1
variable.description: 55a1. F. Invasive procedures. What was the reason for this procedure? [Visit 6]
variable.value: Follow-up after heart attack or procedure

variable.name: MHXB55C3
variable.description: 55c3. F. Invasive procedures. What was the reason for this procedure [Visit 6]
variable.value: Leg pain on walking short distance

variable.name: MHXB56A
variable.description: 56a. G. Diagnostic procedures. Since your last Jackson Heart Study exam, have you had any of the following procedures performed for a medical reason? Echocardiogram [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB56B
variable.description: 56b. G. Diagnostic procedures. Since your last Jackson Heart Study exam, have you had any of the following procedures performed for a medical reason? Electrocardiogram [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB56C
variable.description: 56c. G. Diagnostic procedures. Treadmill or cardiac stress test [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB56A1
variable.description: 56a1. G. Diagnostic procedures. Since your last Jackson Heart Study exam, have you had any of the following procedures performed for a medical reason? What was the reason for this procedure [Visit 6]
variable.value: Follow up after heart attack or surgery

variable.name: MHXB56B1
variable.description: 56b1. G. Diagnostic procedures. Since your last Jackson Heart Study exam, have you had any of the following procedures performed for a medical reason? What was the reason for this procedure [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB56C1
variable.description: 56c1. G. Diagnostic procedures. What was the reason for this procedure? [Treadmill or cardiac stress test] [Visit 6]
variable.value: Follow-up after heart attack or procedure

variable.name: MHXB56D
variable.description: 56d. G. Diagnostic procedures. MRI exam of the brain? [Visit 6]

variable.name: MHXB56D1
variable.description: 56d1. G. Diagnostic procedures. What was the reason for this procedure [Visit 6]
